result.execSummary:
The defendant Paul M. Christianson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Criminal Damage to Property, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Paul M. Christianson

records.addlTxt: w/Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 2:06 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Pauline Toulouse.  
Plea Quest/Waiver of Rights & Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief filed.  VRCW.
State moves to DRI Ct.2- Resisting or Obstructing an Officer.
COURT GRANTS. 
PLEA: Ct.1- Criminal Damage to Property>>NO CONTEST
COURT advises def of rights (including constitutional rights) & penalties & ques def to understanding.  
COURT finds plea & waiver of rights freely & vol made: a factual basis & def guilty. 
COURT ORDERS: $50.00 fine plus CC & DNA surcharge. 
Adj: 2:12 p.m.
Plea hearing on June 9, 2015 at 02:00 pm.

Clerk: Britney
Case Called: 2:27 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Pauline Toulouse. Date & time set for Final Pre-trial. State notes parties are close to reaching an agreement. 
JT is to stay on. If parties do not reach an agreement, Jury Instructions and Motions in Limine to be filed one week prior to JT. 30 jurors to be called. 
Adj: 2:27 p.m.

Jury Trial on June 2, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final Pretrial/ten. plea on May 13, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Clerk: Britney 
Case Called: 3:39 p.m. 
State appears by ADA Desiree Toldt. Defendant appears in person with Attorney Pauline Toulouse. Parties have not yet reached an agreement. State requests adjournment of JT to allow more time for parties to confer and obtain information. 
COURT adjourns JT. 
Future dates to be set with JA following court. 
Adj: 3:40 p.m.

Pre-trial conference on March 26, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Jury Trial on May 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Final pre-trial on April 29, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Shall have his/her fingerprints and photograph taken at the Sheriff's Dept.   No contact with victim(s): E.M.-L. Contact includes direct personal or physical and indirect contact by phone, in writing of any kind, entry to the person's residence or place of employment together with contacts through other persons.  Contact, however, may be made through the defendant's attorney.
